Author: tpc
linked_microtrends: A-Commerce,Body As Interface,Instant Written Customer Service
App_description: Virtual assistants can provide quick information to customers, employees or partners on the go. These assistants can be available to remote users through smartphones, smart speakers, or smart appliances. Presential users can access these assistants through kiosks. Chatbots can provide quick information to customers, employees or partners on the go. Can be made available through dedicated messaging APPs like WhatsAPP or embedded in existing channels like the on-line stores or APPs.

Author: aec
App_description:
Automatic ordering and checkout is the simplest embodiment of the A-commerce trend. The aim of this application is always to rid the customer journey of all friction at the checkout and ordering stages. Subconsciously, if companies already carry so much data on consumers, why should they ever have to ask for confirmation/details on an action they've performed tens, hundreds or even thousands of times.
I've bought the same toilet paper for 3 years in a row, can the multi-million euro retailer I shop at pick up on that?

Author: aec
App_description: Automated styling is the most organic practical hemisphere of automated commerce. This previously sci-fi reserved ambition, would in theory (not for long) curate a consumer's cart whenever they need an extra hand with choosing or simply aren't interested in spending time differentiating between two products. For some, shopping for a summer wardrobe is a ritual, for others a pain. Despite it all, with select products and services, a majority of people don't necessarily value time spent in choosing - think detergent, toilet paper, toothpaste. Wouldn't it be amazing to have the "just choose the cheapest one" or "get me anything whitening and minty".

Author: aec
App_description: While we can tackle the aging problem by leveraging complex engineering solutions, the human dimension remains. This sphere is often harder to approach due to its inherent abstractiveness and inertia for culture change. A well-oiled corporate environment in the future will necessarily nurture collaboration between senior and junior employees - optimizing knowledge transfer and better exploring the value of experience so commonly overlooked.

Author: nlg
App_description: Making part-time or freelance job opportunities available to retirees to overcome scarcity of labour and allow them an extra income stream and a renewed sense of purpose.

Author: tpc
App_description: Provide tools that deliver quick and relevant information for employees of customer care (call centres) to allow the written contact with several customers simultaneously.

Author: aec
App_description:
With robots and automation making more and more frequent appearances in our everyday lives, we, people, are confronted with the progressive decrease in human interaction. Despite this, at our core, we are social animals, and we like being with other people (whether we like it or not, ah!). A collateral consequence that arises is that people give authenticity and humanity higher value. Federico Marchetti said it beautifully when he predicted that "in the future there will be one label that will convey [a sense quality] to the customers - 'Made by Humans'".
Making the right choices when it comes to automation isn't always limited to efficiency and cost. Allowing the human touch to permeate your products and services where it matters most, can be a powerful loyalty driver, justifying and even contradicting RPAs or seamlessness.

Author: man
App_description: With an increasing number of open borders and conflit fleeding populations, big cities incorporate the work of more and more nationalities. This forces cultures to cohabit in the same spaces, having influences in food and cultural options available.

Author: aec
App_description:
Interfacing is a hot topic nowadays. Depending on the industry, a platform's ease of use (or lack thereof) can overturn entire business ventures. It is unquestionable that we veer towards a future where human-machine interfaces are more organic, aiming to eradicate learning curves.
Currently, voice control is, with little doubt, the closest we have to achieving the fluidity necessary for this - we certainly must teach someone what "Ctrl+A" is, and does anything interesting, but shouting "Hey Siri, play me the Beatles" comes second to language (and some good taste...).

Author: aec
App_description: Another iteration in the new interface world, motion control is one that ambitions (arguably) the easiest learning processes. Motion for control is an obvious extension of our sensorial world. A trivial example is the simple but revolutionary "pinch-to-zoom" gesture popularised to omnipresence (and usually attributed to Apple's first iPhone).

Author: tpc
App_description: People use their unique biological traits to be identified, manage access to resources or authorize payments through voice, fingerprint or iris recognition. After the biometric identification employees, partners and customers access admission-controlled assets (e.g. offices, technical areas, or lockers) or classified information (e.g. interaction with customer care, or APPs) without using codes or cards.

Author: man
App_description: Lives are changing, with easy access to different lifestyles people may not be dedicated to traditional activities anymore. This means that tasks like buying raw and cooking may be replaced for ordering in, having take-away food or eating out. By transforming supermarkets into food preparation locations we are creating an in-between of restaurants and home-cooking.

Author: aec
App_description: While Flexible Workplaces is an unquestionable trending success

Author: jgp
App_description: The new technological revolution is drastically decreasing the average half-life of learned skills. Thus, it's of the utmost importance for companies and employees to adapt to the roulette of new scenarios by gathering as many tools as possible. Knowledge is quantic nowadays.

Author: nlg
App_description: Offering open enrollment courses through the web/mobile.

Author: nlg
App_description: Organizing courses and workshops to help customers make the best choices and the best use of the products/services they buy.

Author: jgp
App_description:
Addressing the need to belong is the oldest commercial trick in the book. People want to be a part of something and brands must be able to address that social requirement. The good news is that the digital transformation that we're living in is boosting the businesses' ability to do it.

The digital age is skyrocketing the (peer) pressure through the roof, which, for retailers, represents both an opportunity (the feeling of emergency and the fear of missing out are sales drivers) and a threat (people's increasing desire to disconnect and to subscribe to digital detox programs or lifestyles).

Author: jgp
App_description:
Brands are living inside its customers' pockets 24/7. The ability for retailers to create the feeling of emergency is, therefore, higher than it ever was. 

People want to belong and to feel unique and businesses have an unprecedented opportunity to take advantage of those (apparently) paradoxical needs.

Author: jgp
App_description: It's not just about flexible hours or hot desks anymore. Different employees have different needs and now more than ever, companies must be willing to listen and to accommodate as many requirements as possible.

App_description: Offering spaces in store that invite and provide adequate conditions for customers to work and organize gatherings.

App_description: Allowing employees to work partly or mainly from other places than office.

App_description: Living in a world of personalization means stop applying the one size fits all to everyone and that means accepting people in their differences in more serious environments.

App_description: With specific tests being more affordable - like genetic tests - diet plans can be more informed and tackle different types of bodies and what works for them.

Author: man
App_description:
Technology adoption among is universally attributed to Millenials and younger generations. This is partly true, but leads to a gross underestimation of tech use in older generations. Especially older urban dwellers are more than happy to adopt smart locks for safety, kitchen assistants for convenient cooking and uber to stop waiting for a taxi while it's raining.
This proves to be a greatly misrepresented segment that embodies a great business oportunity, if only companies start planning around it (remember older generations also have greater purchasing power).

Author: tpc
App_description: Provide a range of products that ease the health monitoring. A range of services that take advantage of these health monitoring devices such as sleep advising.

Author: tpc
App_description:
Besides providing products with heathy features, communicate these features through the adequate channels. People are eager to learn more about health, so provide information for customers and employees about what is healthy (foods and behaviours) and promote discussions about pros and cons of controversy topics.

Create initiatives for customer and for employees that promote healthy habits such as sports events, or educative workshops about food, postures, or stress management.
